summary: U.S. foreign partners buy billions of dollars of defense items and services annually through the U.S. Foreign Military Sales program. To transport the items they buy, buyers pay fees that should roughly equal what the U.S. government pays to transport the goods. However, the transportation fee account balances have grown by over 1300%. Because there was no guidance on how to determine whether account balances...
title: Foreign Military Sales: DOD Should Strengthen Oversight of Its Growing Transportation Account Balances
